news.title: A year later, Bengaluru development body rectifies OC stance
news.para: Karnataka Home Buyers Forum Convenor says although OCs mentioned 10 per cent of flats were reserved for EWS, these were often non-existent, with the scam coming to end due to HC’s intervention. BDA issues circular in line with High Court’s ruling deeming mandatory EWS reservation for issuance of OCs in private properties as unconstitutional

news.title: Karnataka government gears up to issue e-khatas for 97 lakh rural properties
news.para: Karnataka's RDPR department is set to launch 'Eswathu to doorsteps' in October, issuing over 97 lakh e-khatas to bridge the digital divide in rural areas. A dedicated helpdesk will assist citizens, ensuring accountability and addressing grievances. The initiative aims to streamline property documentation, eliminating the need for physical visits to gram panchayat offices.

news.title: Bombay HC grants three weeks extension for Tardeo tower residents to vacate
news.para: The Bombay High Court has extended the deadline by three weeks for residents of the top 18 floors of a Tardeo tower to vacate, following a Supreme Court order upholding the eviction due to lack of occupancy certificates.

news.title: DDA begins rent payouts for Signature View residents; clears decks for redevelopment
news.para: DDA has commenced compensatory rent payments to residents of Signature View Apartments in Mukherjee Nagar, facilitating the redevelopment of the inhabitable complex. Fifty-six residents who submitted documents and vacated their flats have received rent until July. The RWA, while welcoming the move, seeks clarity on annual rent increases and other unresolved issues through legal channels.

news.title: Lavasa set to go for rebids as creditors extend timeline
news.para: Creditors of Lavasa Corporation are extending the resolution deadline after a late bid revision by Valor Estate. This decision allows all bidders another chance to increase their offers, despite objections from other bidders and homebuyers who cite fairness and delays. Lenders aim to maximize recovery and avoid future litigation, prompting the extension.

news.title: Launch of greenfield townships in Uttar Pradesh ahead of festive season
news.para: Uttar Pradesh is set to launch over a dozen affordable greenfield townships across key cities before Diwali, following directives from the state government to expedite land aggregation.

news.title: Hyderabad civic body swings hammer o​n illegal constructions
news.para: Following Telangana High Court directives, Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation intensifies crackdown on illegal constructions. Since January, GHMC identified 1,538 illegal structures, issuing 1,517 notices, demolishing 204, and sealing 93 buildings. Violations include unauthorized floors and plan deviations, rampant in areas like Banjara Hills. The High Court criticized GHMC for unchecked violations, now sealing floors alongside issuing notices.

news.title: Dissolution of SEIAA & SEAC delays environmental clearances approval in Delhi
news.para: The dissolution of Delhi's State Level Environment Impact Assessment Authority (SEIAA) and State Level Expert Appraisal Committee (SEAC) in September 2024 has caused environmental clearance delays, as highlighted by a builder's plea to the National Green Tribunal (NGT).

news.title: Over 300 housing & commercial projects in Gurugram flout norms, skip STP checks
news.para: Many Gurugram real estate projects did not install STP analysers. Haryana State Pollution Control Board shared the data. These projects include housing societies, IT parks and malls. Only a few projects installed the analysers. Environmentalists are concerned about untreated sewage. The pollution board will review the lack of physical verification. Action will be taken against violators.

news.title: Telangana RERA penalises Haris Pranava Builders & Kapstone Properties
news.para: Telangana RERA has penalized Haris Pranava Builders ₹7.6 lakh for construction deviations and failing to provide promised amenities at Pranava Elite, following a complaint by flat owners. Kapstone Properties India Pvt Ltd faces a ₹21 lakh penalty for violations in their 'Little Woods' plotted development, including failing to register plots after receiving payments.

news.title: The Durst Organization closes on $1.3 billion loan for a Times Square skyscraper
news.para: The Durst Organization secured a substantial $1.3 billion CMBS loan for One Five One, a Times Square skyscraper, signaling confidence in New York City's Class A office market. The financing, co-originated by Wells Fargo, JPMorgan, and Bank of America, will fund tenant improvements and capital expenditures.

news.title: REA Group gains on profit jump, dividend hike
news.para: Shares of REA Group in Australia witnessed a sharp rise. This followed the announcement of strong full-year profit. The company also increased its final dividend. Attributable net profit rose by 23 percent. Record annual revenue was reported. The housing market is showing signs of resurgence. A new chief executive will be appointed in September.

news.title: Hong Kong's New World shares surge on report of take-private deal talks
news.para: New World Development's shares experienced a significant surge following reports of a potential take-private deal. The Hong Kong property developer and the Cheng family are reportedly in talks with Blackstone for a financing deal that could lead to a joint take-private offer. The discussions are preliminary and could involve a substantial investment.

news.title: Dubai's Emaar Properties reports 33% jump in profit in H1 2025
news.para: Emaar, Dubai's leading real estate developer, announced a significant 33% increase in its first-half net profit, reaching 7.08 billion dirhams. This surge was fueled by a robust 46% rise in property sales, driven by Dubai's thriving property market attracting global buyers. Emaar's revenue backlog from property sales also saw a substantial 62% increase, reaching 146.3 billion dirhams.

news.title: Passport case against businessman Sushil Ansal: Delhi court allows AVUT to assist prosecution
news.para: A Delhi court has permitted the Association of the Victims of Uphaar Tragedy (AVUT) to assist the prosecution in a fraud case against Sushil Ansal, who was previously convicted in the 1997 Uphaar cinema fire tragedy. The case involves allegations that Ansal provided false information to obtain his passport.

news.title: JSW Cement garners ₹1,080 crore from anchor investors ahead of IPO
news.para: JSW Cement garnered Rs 1,080 crore from anchor investors, including Nomura and the Government of Singapore, prior to its IPO launch. The IPO, opening August 7-11, aims to raise Rs 3,600 crore through a fresh issue and offer for sale. Proceeds will fund a new cement unit and debt repayment, despite the company reporting a loss in FY25.

news.title: Land pooling policy put on hold till next hearing on Aug 7: Punjab AG submits in HC
news.para: The Punjab and Haryana High Court addressed a petition challenging Punjab's land pooling scheme. The state's advocate general announced a hold on the policy until the next hearing. The court questioned the policy's impact on landless laborers and the environment. It directed the state to provide information on rehabilitation provisions and impact assessments.

news.title: Prestige Hospitality Ventures get Sebi's nod for IPO
news.para: Prestige Hospitality Ventures, an arm of realty firm Prestige Estates Projects, is aiming to raise Rs 2,700 crore through its IPO, comprising a fresh issue of equity shares valued at Rs 1,700 crore, and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of equity shares worth Rs 1,000 crore, according to the draft red herring prospectus (DRHP).

news.title: Knowledge Realty Trust REIT IPO gets 3.4 times subscription on day 2 of offer
news.para: The NSDL IPO saw strong demand, being oversubscribed 3.42 times on its second day, driven by significant interest from corporates, individuals, and institutional investors. Knowledge Realty Trust's Rs 4,800-crore IPO, reduced from an initial Rs 6,200 crore, aims to monetise prime office assets and establish KRT as India's largest REIT.

news.title: Sri Lotus Developers and Realty stock rallies over 31% in debut trade
news.para: Sri Lotus Developers and Realty, backed by Ashish Kacholia, saw a strong market debut. The stock closed with over 31% premium on Wednesday. The IPO was subscribed nearly 70 times. The company raised funds from institutional investors. Sri Lotus focuses on luxury redevelopment projects in Mumbai. The market capitalization reached over Rs 9,620 crore.
